lines.text:
[playing house]
I should bloody damn and bloody blast and bugger and bloody flaming bloody well think so and all. Give us a kiss!

[pretending that he's cut his thumb off at the sawmill]
Nine or ten pints of scrumpy, that's what I want; I've lost a lot of blood!

Into my heart, an air that kills from yon far country blows. What are those Blue Remembered Hills? What spires, what farms are those? That is the land of lost content. I see it shining plain. The happy highways where I went. And cannot come again.

[talking about Donald]
Poor old Quack Quack!

[Donald Duck's last words]
Burn you bloody bugger, burn! If you haven't, the Japs have won!
